snippet: The experts’ statement came as a verdict was expected any day in the case of Jason Rezaian, the Washington Post correspondent who has been held since July 2014.
abstract: United Nations human rights experts say yearlong imprisonment and closed trial of Jason Rezaian, Washington Post journalist facing espionage charges in Iran’s Revolutionary Court, is violation of international law and press freedom; denouncement, made after fourth and final hearing, is effort to pressure Iran into releasing Rezaian who faces up to 20 years if convicted.
lead_paragraph: The experts’ statement came as a verdict was expected any day in the case of Jason Rezaian, the Washington Post correspondent who has been held since July 2014.

headline.main: U.N. Rights Experts Urge Iran to Free Washington Post’s Jason Rezaian
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Iran: More Calls for Reporter’s Release
